item.title: Report E-2024060543
item.description:
Report E-2024060543

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4-gallons of Grain Alcohol 200 proof released from one (1) 350-gallon IBC metal tote impacting the concrete dock floor. The lid had popped off during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and the proper PPE available on site. The waste was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060538
item.description:
Report E-2024060538

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the recovered spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
